posts.content:
How can a single port manifold gasket be £2.30 plus £3.95 postage from VW Heritage?

http://www.vwheritage.com/vw_spares_Inlet-manifold-gasket-single-port-1300-1500-1600-311129707D_act_shop.product_pID_133248.htm

Or £2.80 plus £1.50 postage on their eBay page:-

http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/TYPE-2-BAY-Inlet-manifold-gasket-single-port-1300-1500-160-20/390759733859?_trksid=p2045573.c100033.m2042&_trkparms=aid%3D111001%26algo%3DREC.SEED%26ao%3D1%26asc%3D20131017132637%26meid%3D7862685071210285404%26pid%3D100033%26prg%3D20131017132637%26rk%3D2%26rkt%3D4%26sd%3D281255513176

When it is only 65p from JK, admittedly £1.45 postage.

http://www.justkampers.com/311-129-707-d-inlet-manifold-gasket-for-single-port-engines-1300-1600cc.html
Unfortunately thats life mate, as the saying goes it pays to shop around

JK have found a generic copper ring and put their markup on it.

Heritage have done the same, but it might be a correct copper ring, or maybe they've just whacked on a massive markup.

I might have some of those, as its not something I'll ever use myself, I'll have a look later. Postage would be cheaper too

Guess I should have asked if anyone had any spare as there are 2 of them in every gasket set you buy, unfortunately I have ordered some from JK now.

If anyone needs any twin port gasket let me know, I have a stock of them in a drawer!

Also various other gaskets including a mountain of pushrod tube seals but not barrel to block gaskets.

Happy to help, perhaps we should have a sticky on bus parts for sale for people to list this sort of thing?

Richard
